Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: k H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at Hotel Torino this week - very happy. The hotel is ten minutes walk from Termini Station, and walkable to all parts of city. The room wasn't huge, but staff were consistently very helpful and friendly - we were able to have our room by 1pm when we checked in - the breakfast choice excellent - there are many restaurants within 200metres of the hotel. Carpets brand new everywhere - everything worked, and perfectly clean. There is noise from the street and traffic even though the hotel is on a side street - but this is ROME! Oh and the souvenir shop next door has everything that all the other souvenirs have and is just as cheap. Very happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulinhobeccon
Reviews.Content: I was a bit anxious before my stay at Torino Hotel after reading the some bad reviews,But after 5 days stay at Torino I can assure you the hotel is absolutely fine. Great location, nice rooms and a descent breakfast with a really nice outdoor seating area. The staff is not mega friendly, but did their work. The location is the plus of the hotel. really close to Termini form where you can get to anywhere. The area is really safe like the rest of Rome. The hotel is not a 5 star super hotel, but its far from a a bad one either. You will be totally fine here.

Reviews.Title: “BO1”
Reviews.Author: MANFRED N Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: friendly people at the frontdesk breakfast very good excellent distance to ground-transport door to bathroom didn't close you need ear-plugs

Reviews.Title: “Good location and services”
Reviews.Author: CorinaAB
Reviews.Content: Closed to the Termini station, good for visiting the most of the attractions. Good value for the money. Nice room and cold buffet breakfast. Great espresso coffee :) Very friendly staff, except a not smiling lady which is apparently a chief. She has to learn from the hardworking staff, which she trates not so well. One morning, she fighted against them during 10 minutes, in the breakfast room. I dont remember to pay for such a show, she ruined my morning. This kind of scenes are the only weak point founded during my stay. Good hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just average”
Reviews.Author: MSev13
Reviews.Content: Hotel Torino looks very nice from the entrance and the lobby area. The rooms were not that nice. Our window was looking into dirty backyard and it needs refurbishment. Beds were comfortable. Airconditioning had a piled up dirt on the fan. Not a 4 star standard, hardly 3 star. The breakfast was great, great variety of sweets and a great coffee. The breakfast staff was very nice. Overall experinec was average considering the price we paid. Not worth it in high season when the room is €118 which is too much for this standard in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just run away.”
Reviews.Author: Swalosky
Reviews.Content: Dirty, without light, bad service, 4 stars? I hate to write bad reviews but in this case i had to. I would never come back to this hotel and pay SO MUCH money for such a BAD service. This is one of the reasons of why i prefer to stay in small places. Neither my wife or i liked it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pellegrino1
Reviews.Content: Awful service, rude staff, disgusting room, moldy shower, sewerage odour, room doors don't lock...issue not rectified. Breakfast was a chaotic joke and limited. This is not a 4 star hotel!! Possibly 2 stars

Reviews.Title: “Avg Stay”
Reviews.Author: Prijain13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days and enjoyed the stay in hotel as it was a minute away from train station. In fact the hotel is located in the center so most of the popular sightseeing was easily accessible. While stay in the hotel wasnt good as it is not so clean and staff wasnt helping at all.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your expectations low and you may be just fine.”
Reviews.Author: alan f
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a lousy experience here in mid September. From the English-speaking front desk staff who couldn't have cared less, to the peeling wallpaper, to the empty bottle left in the room, to the toilet that didn't work in a semi-clean bathroom, the hotel was unattractive on many levels. Did I mention there were no bed springs? When I told the front desk staff that the toilet didn't work, the gentleman said "I'm sorry" but I got the feeling he's heard that complaint many times,as he brushed me off to serve the next guest who was desperately trying to check out. Breakfast was OK and the coffee machine even made a decent cappuccino. It's close to the train station so I'm pretty sure they want the overnight stopover guest. There is no reason to stay there again. It's obvious that hotel ratings are meaningless in the three or four class range. The low point of an otherwise great two week vacation.

Reviews.Title: “4* hotel ?? Definately NOT.”
Reviews.Author: roscotrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in mid September 2011. It was booked several months before and I was aware of some of the reviews. Whoever grades the hotels in Rome have got this one wrong. It is by no means a four star. Our room, on the first floor overlooking the main street was generally small and the bathroom tiny. The bathroom was moderately clean although the shower tiles could have done with a spray of disinfectant. The furniture / wardrobe was old and outdated. There was mould/mildew on the ceiling above the door as you walked in. Generally, the room was in need of a refurb. The reception area however was done very smart with a sense of "olde worlde" about it. Breakfast was average - usual continental style and nothing to write home about although did fill a gap. Some of the staff on reception could do with a course in customer relations. Perhaps a smile every now and again and engage the customer in conversation about their trip wouldn't have gone a miss. The roof top terrace was good. There was plenty of seating up there and provided an escape for an hour to sit and relax, watching the hustle and bustle of the streets below. The bonus side of this hotel is its location. It is situated just a two minute walk away from the central train station and bus / tram terminus. This was extremely useful to us as we had bought a Roma Card and used public transport a lot. As they say, all roads lead to Rome, in our case, all buses and trams led to within 2 minutes of our hotel. The area that the hotel is situated in was also quite pleasant. There are ample cafes/bars/restaurants very close by and some lovely buildings / architecture to explore just moments away. We paid 313 Euros for our three night stay here, and then there was an extra 18 Euros on top for the "tourist tax". Being classed as a 4 star hotel, the tax meant we paid 3 Euros each a night. If this was a 3 start hotel it would have been 2 Euros each a night. All in all, the hotel experience didn't ruin our holiday, but when you stay at what is advertised as a 4* hotel, you would expect better. If I had to do it again, I wouldn't stay here, but would go to either a 3* hotel whose prices reflect it, or pay a little more for a genuine 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Morten016
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Torino has a fine reception with english speaking staff, that is manned 24 hrs. And the roof terrase is nice, eventhough the nice furniture and flowers from the pictures has been replaced with somewhat more basic furniture of metal. That is positive. Also the location is fine, with 5 min to the trainstation and metro, or if you like to walk, about 15 mins to Colosseum and 20 min to the historical centre. But besides that, the hotel should not be rated a four star hotel. The rooms are clean, but old and especially the bathroom is not acceptable for a hotel with four stars. Using the shower with the old fixed showerhead mounted to the wall, leaves the floor a mess. And I am sorry to say this, but we had to use the plastic wastebin to flush the toilet, because the water pressure just was not nearly enough. The breakfast was acceptable, but only with bake-off bread and no bacon/eggs or similar. Again - that is okay, just not what you expect from a four star hotel. And the bathroom in the room - there is just no excuse but that it must be a deliberate choise not to fix them. One final thing on the nice roof terrase - besides for the breakfast service, there is no staff or bar at the terrase (and no bar anywhere else in the hotel) - so we had to go to the nearest shop to buy beverages.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: sriraam9380
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel , for a night before our cruise. The hotel is in a very tourist convenient locale. It is quiet close to the central train station and also in the middle of the ancient Rome. It is actually situated, very close to the colloseum.. The rooms are ok , though could have been better .. The bathroom was neat and clean.. The breakfast was provided in the restaurant at the terrace.. The food was very good.. Overall, the hotel is a little over priced , but nevertheless a good choice , just for the location..

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a convenient Roman neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: OutofKansas
Reviews.Content: Generally I avoid hotels near train stations, but we were getting desperate to find something appropriate in Rome and, although more expensive than we had hoped, the Torino was near a hotel our friends recommended. We found that being near the Stazione Termini was a great location, with loads of good restaurants in the neighborhood and easy access to the Metro. We also could walk to many important sites. The hotel is air conditioned, with relatively small rooms but good facilities. One night our toilet ran all night, but it was fixed the next day. The bathroom was fine, the bed was comfortable, we had free wifi, and the staff were very helpful in getting us to the contemporary museums we wanted to see. In fact we were impressed at how convenient transportation to the relatively distant MAXXI and MACRO was. Although the area is bustling, the room was very quiet. Breakfast is on the 7th floor, with a roof terrace option that we enjoyed quite a lot. It has some high flying pigeons that can be a nuisance, but all in all was very pleasant. My only complaint there was the machine that made sweet capuccino or small portions of cafe macchiato. Our other hotels provided real capuccino. The Hotel Torino led me to think that the train station area in Rome may be a really good place to stay; I've always stayed near the Spanish Steps or Piazza Navona before. The negative about this hotel is only that the exchange rate made it more expensive than it should be, but they can't help that.

Reviews.Title: “basic 3 star hotel but good value”
Reviews.Author: stillatit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in June and have no complaints for the price charged. What do people expect for three stars. Location great and room clean and tidy. Bathroom functional and working. Breakfst on a par with other hotels of the same standard in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: beckhow
Reviews.Content: I was incredibly disappointed in Hotel Torino. I was with a group of 28 college students studying abroad and we all took a 5 day trip to Rome. My room was one of the many that did not have a working toilet. We notified the desk and they said they would fix it the next day, but after one use, it would always break again. We were forced to either go to the lobby or to the 7th floor to use the bathroom if we ever needed to go. Also, room service is impossibly slow. We asked to have 3 forks sent up so we could eat some of the food we brought with us and it wasn't until 4 hours later that we had gotten them. The breakfast is delicious but the staff allowed the pigeons from the city land on the breakfast table settings on the outside patio. So be careful as to where you sit because it wasn't uncommon for us to see a bird land on a set of forks and knives and the staff not put out clean ones. Internet is provided but VERY unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “not really come back”
Reviews.Author: SvetlanaUkraine
Reviews.Content: Average hotel for 3*, how he could be rated 4* don't know... single rooms 5 square meters - just bed and the door to the bath next to the bed

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not very special”
Reviews.Author: MiOd
Reviews.Content: During my stay workers were busy with new carpets on the stairs -- the smell of the carpet glue was not the most pleasant. Apart from that: everything that I needed for a hotel, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Would choose somewhere else next visit”
Reviews.Author: AusTravelGirl_11
Reviews.Content: We were booked here for 3 nights and I expected from the price and the photos on their website that it might be fairly good. The best part to this hotel was its location. Easy to jump on the metro and trains. Other than this the wallpaper was falling off, where it wasn't it was badly scuffed, there were water stains all over the ceiling, the bed was lumpy, wi-fi at times difficult to connect to properly (granted though it was free) staff seemed under pressure and were not welcoming or particularly helpful, you certainly had to ask the basic questions (like when breakfast is served (7-10am fyi) and the bed was quite lumpy. not a terrible hotel but certainly not one I would choose to return to.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel ....Not!!”
Reviews.Author: Calfan63
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 days with my family for our first trip to Italy. We stayed in a "Quad" room which had 1 room with 2 single beds and 1 room (master) with a double bed which was 2 singles put together. The mattresse were very thin and uncomfortable for starters and hot water in the shower was hard to come by. We had 2 days whereour power went out and was not easy to get them to turn back on. The front desk was not very helpful and did not really offer up much help. The maid service left alot to be desired....made bed and moved things around no real cleaning. The room furnishings were old and not well cared for and toilet leaked...never fixed durring stay. On the upside the hotel is in a pretty good location only a couple of blocks from the Termini train station and within walking distance of quite a few sites (coliseum, Trevi, Piazza Nevona) and good resturants. All in all i would not reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “NOT RECCOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: AlanLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I stated for 2 nights 26th/27th Jan. with colleagues to attend a conference and we found the staff to be surly and unhelpful(they need to learn how to smile),the first morning there was no hot water in the Hotel and despite the guests complaining there was none until the afternoon and then it was only warm. the Hotel is old fashioned the. rooms dark and the beds uncomfortable,The Saving grace for the Hotel is that it was very clean and the cold buffet breakfast was plentiful and acceptable.It could be only be classed as a Budget Hotel,fortunately for ourselves we were'nt paying the bill. I would'nt return to it for either business or leisure and won't be reccommending it to anyone else

Reviews.Title: “not really ****”
Reviews.Author: LMitterer
Reviews.Content: the hotel is quite o.k. - but it is definitely not a real ****venue. the breaktfast is very simple and nothing that has to be mentioned. the room was clean and simple, but quite small. the beds are comfortable, the whole place was clean. The service was ok. all in all this hotel is not really a **** hotel, as you would expect it. but the price was very low.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but not too helpful”
Reviews.Author: spry13
Reviews.Content: Only a few blocks from main train station. This is a limited service hotel. One elevator. Have numerous steps up from street to lobby, and then another half flight up to elevator level. No staff to assist with luggage. Desk staff not very helpful. No internet service - use internet cafes to east on same street. Breakfast on top floor with indoor or outdoor seating.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mosaiciste
Reviews.Content: A little shabby, but the room was clean and the bathroom stocked with toiletries, and it is located just 2 blocks from the central train station. This is the second time I have stayed there, and again noticed that the man who covers the desk during the day gets impatient because of the many people coming and going. It's a very popular hotel. But this time I smiled and asked him for just a minute of his time to answer a question for me, and he smiled back and was very helpful even asking if I needed a wake up call. They didn't have a restaurant but there is an informal place just a couple of doors down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Affodable Rome”
Reviews.Author: jimbocnewyork_NY
Reviews.Content: For what you pay the Torino is a good value. It is no frills but for a small price we got a clean comfortable room with an ample breakfast. Don't have breakfast on the terrace or you will be sharing it with pigeons-stay in the dining room. The location is good as it is convenient to the train station and all major attractions. The staff, while lacking in charm, is efficient but to be fair they do seem to work hard. If you want upscale, go elsewhere, but if you're on a budget go here.

Reviews.Title: “Dont book this place if you truly expect 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: MTVB80
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel during our honeymoon for one night and I was glad to have only been there for one night! There was only one person working behind the desk and he seemed bored and disinterested. We didnt get any help with our luggage and had to push for concierge services such as marking things on a map. The room was really small and the beds were extremely old and springy, very uncomfortable. The carpet didnt look clean. There wasnt enough water pressure for a continous shower - at least the air conditioning worked! I expected more toiletries for a 4 star hotel such as tissues but maybe I've been spoiled at other 4 star hotels. Breakfast is average, the view on the terrace is nice but coffee terrible, the waiter was on his mobile phone the whole time. The concierge forgot to call our taxi to the airport. Some of the other reviews have nailed the experience at this hotel - I would not go back, I'd rather try somewhere else in this area and there are many hotels to choose from with similar cost. Definetly NOT 4 star!!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Svenskturist
Reviews.Content: Service - 5 Room .- 3 Bathroom - 3 Breakfast - 3 Location - 5 (close to Termini Railwaystation) Price - 4 (76 Euro / night dbl room)

Reviews.Title: “A true surprise”
Reviews.Author: elmadanat1961
Reviews.Content: After coming back to Rome from a cruise to the east mediterranean starting from Venice , we booked one night in Torino hotel since we were flying back home next day , i usualy book two rooms one for me and my wife the other for my two kids , but this time i booked one room for four . I was a little pet worried that the room might be small , but for our surprise they gave us what looks like a junior sweet with two separated rooms both were big enough , plasma TV , a safe , large bathroom with a jacuzzi , breakfast was rich . The hotel is located in a nice area about 200 meters from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Greeting”
Reviews.Author: anuska_1987
Reviews.Content: I would like to express satisfaction with the stay in Your hotel, from the welcome by the receptionist Mr Salvatore, through the nice service of Mrs. Josiammie and whole staff of room service and breakfast room. I would like to pay attention to purity in all of the rooms and the whole hotel. My rating is 10 to 10

Reviews.Title: “ask to see the room before booking it....”
Reviews.Author: B_Andrei
Reviews.Content: we have tried to find a resonabile hotel in Rome for a 5 day trip, and online all those were seriously over 100 euros, and reviews to most were bad. therefore we got to Rome with no booking to any hotel, and we went door to door when we got out of the train to ask for prices and rooms in the vicinity of the train station. We, as sesoned travelers, asked to see the room before we decided to take it, and we got a quiet room, kinda small but ok, the bath is only with shower, clean. The wireless in the hotel is for money (5 euros for 2 hours). The TV is small and has only free local tv (no CNN or other english/international channels). Breakfast was ok on the terrace of the building,

Reviews.Title: “Dust and thin mattress - hard to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Footballerswife
Reviews.Content: Hi, Be aware of this hotel if you cannot stand dust, have asthma etc. There are carpets that are extremely dirty and probably not vacuumed for ages. Beds are also very hard due to thin mattress, you might end up having problems with your back. Best things are proper breakfast in the roof terrace, fairly good service in check-in desk and high-speed WLAN (extra charge). .

Reviews.Title: “TOO EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: Derek_M_Speranza
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at the Torino Hotel in Rome which is classified as a 4 star. The single room is very small and the batroom although very clean is too small . To close or open the bathroom door one has to make sure to be out of the way as otherwise, there will not be enough room to enter. The room is so small that there was hardly any space to put the luggauge aside. Definetley this hotel should not be classified as a 4 star. The price was over rated . The only possitive thing about the hotel that it is very central and convenient . As for the staff they were very helpfull . The breakfast was also good. Derek Mifsud Speranza. Malta

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saikhnaa
Reviews.Content: Location is fine since it locates near the metro station, so you can go everywhere you want easily. Hotel is not a worth 4 star hotel. Staff at front desk wasn't very friendly, made us waiting for him finish his phone talk or computer work for sometime. We reserved room for double, but the bed turned out to be twin bed put together instead of double bed. After bugging front desk several times we got it changed. There is a nice, old man stands at the corner of the Torino asking people to enter into his restaurant. If you saw him, tell him i am sorry that i couldn't keep my promise to go to his restaurant. You should go there. Wi-fi is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to railway station”
Reviews.Author: DTWinfield
Reviews.Content: I have used this hotel several times. Rooms and suites are in period with the architecture of the surrounding area. The hotel is clean and the rooms are of a high standard. You can walk or catch the metro easily to most of Romes attractions. All the staff are nice and helpful. Breakfast overlooking Rome is nice and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to railway and bus station. Not a 4* hotel very poor facilities.”
Reviews.Author: lindajane24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the main bus and rail stations. Take the Terravision bus from the airport only 4 euros each way. On the downside our room was very small. No satellite TV, no room service, no restaurant, the bar remained closed at all times. The breakfast was quite poor, typical continental croissants etc. Not really a 4* hotel. On a positive note it was within walking distance to all the main sight seeing and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pza
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on the 4th of November and there was such a hassle at the reception desk. (by the way the reception desk you see on line is not the actual check in desk), it is much smaller than the one you see on-line. I don't know why they don't use it as it is nice and roomy. We booked 2 rooms as we were travelling with our daughter and a friend of hers. Our room looked ok until I went into the bathroom, hair in the shower and in the sink, tiles broken, water faucet not working. The girls room was dark and old. We then changed rooms, they were better (at least clean). I think they really need to fix the place up a bit, management should check each room once cleaned. Friendly reception personell. Lots of restaurants nearby etc. Easy access to all sites.

Reviews.Title: “Poor place and too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Gili_S
Reviews.Content: This Hotel Torino was selected by the company and not my choice. Not really my kind of place, it is located not far from the railway station. It has good location maybe but for the price what you pay here you could get much better somewhere else. Anyway, the breakfast on the roof on a sunny morning was the only good thing here, the rest was crap. (so in short, this hotel not worth for what you pay)

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Torino”
Reviews.Author: Happycampersoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Torino for a week with our children aged 10 and 12 - the room was more like an apartment with a separate room for the kids. The staff were always helpful - happily brought a pot of tea to our room. The bathroom was large and clean. The shower took a while to heat up but was eventually fine. The breakfasts were generous and the roof top dining a lovely experience. The location was fantastic with many affordable restaurants less than 100 metres away and walking distance to all the sites. Definately recommend Hotel Torino.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: popperdog
Reviews.Content: The room was so basic it looked like a very neglected boarding house. When we went for breakfast we took one look and decided to try and get something out side of the hotel. I cannot say anything good about his place, it was really very very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice staff, very close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: aybc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only one night as my week long booked hotel was full my first night. I staggered into the Torion at 11am after an 18 hour flight from the West Coast. No rooms were available that early. BUT, the front desk guy saw how tired I was and went and found me a room I could get into immediatly. THAT IS SERVICE! Took a shower and rested, went out into Rome, made possible by this great guy at the desk. This is a classic tourist hotel. A bit frayed at the edges, rooms need a remodel, nice bathroom, BUT one block to Termini Rail Station and Plaza Republica. I consider this a VALUE hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel. Unfriendly Staff. Wouldn't Stay again.”
Reviews.Author: GoGirl426
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Torino for 3 nights over Easter weekend. The only plus about this hotel is really the proximity to Termini station. It made catching an early train to FCO a piece of cake. Other then that, it was only okay. The breakfast buffet was basic--fruit, croissant, coffee. I found the front desk staff, at least the evening staff, to be rather unpleasant. The hotel room was clean, but had a old, tired feel to it. For 3 nights, where we were out of the room from literally 9 am to 10pm, we made it work. However, I would recommend to others that they stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “not a romantic getaway hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jollyjoDevon
Reviews.Content: when my husband announced he had booked a romantic wkend away for valentines in a 4* hotel i was over the moon having got 3 children under the age of 10, i felt this was going to be fab!! i looked up the hotel on the internet, and all pictures looked nice (but don't they always!!) when we arrived there the first felling i had was that it was very quiet. the guy on reception was'nt very hospitable. got to our room and opened the door to find a set of steps down to the bed which i nearly fell down!! the double bed was 2 singles put together, the tv had 3 chanels, all italian, and the bathroom had a hairdryer on the wall with wires sticking out....oh, and no tea/coffee making facilities!!!!!!!! when we asked at reception for a coffee he replied 'i have no-one here to make one' then when we asked about the bar he replied 'the bar is never open unless there is a conference'. the second night when we arrived back in we asked about coffee, and he said 'well, i can't make it can i' this is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in and my rating is lower than 2* DO NOT USE!!!!!!!!!!!!! to top it off , no hot water coming out of the shower!! we will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: agk12
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a 2* hotel and the worst hotel we have ever stayed to say the least. In fact we’ve stayed in 2* hotels better than that. We paid reasonable amount of money for it. We booked a double room and they provided us with a single room with two single beds put together to look like a double. The room was so small and basic we could hardly move around. The only entertainment was a 14’ TV only with Italian channels. The safe wasn’t attached anywhere so someone could take it anyway, no much of a safe. On the first day was not hot water in the hotel so we couldn’t have a shower. There was no space to put our luggage other than the corridor between the bed and the desk, which made movement around the room very awkward. Receptionists were unhelpful and they have done nothing about our complaints. The bar downstairs was never open so couldn’t have even a drink or a coffee in the hotel. Breakfast was poor and very basic. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: HPK5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Rome after staying there 3 days. We had a great time seeing all the sights and enjoying all the good wine and food Rome has to offer. Even though the weather was not great it did not spoil our holiday. The only thing we were not happy about was the hotel. Hotel Torino says its a 4star hotel but in no way does it meet any 4 star requirements. We would say it is more like a 2/3 star. The staff are not friendly at all, they do not help in carrying your suitcase. They do not give any advice on tours, food, nothing. We had to carry the suitcase up some stairs and into a small (and I mean small) lift. The hotel is very old which is ok but the rooms are very small. Clean but very small. We had a double room but the bed was 2 twin beds put together. The bathroom was horrible and was not cleaned on one of the days. The shower is so small you can walk in but you cannot move around or shower properly. You can also hear heavy water pouring down the walls. When one of the above floors use their toilets you can hear the water coming down. The TV has only 1 channel in English and there was only 1 socket in the room to charge your phone, camera etc. which already and 2 extension plugs to it. The only good thing about the hotel was the location. It is less then a couple of minutes walk to the main Terminal station. You can walk to most of the main sites and there are plenty of shops, restaurants, snack bars etc seconds away from the hotel. For the location we would next time stay across the road at the Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: southerntraveler100
Reviews.Content: Located 5 minutes from Termini, 1-2 minutes from 3 restaurants with great authentic food, 15 - 20 minutes from tourist sites, 3 minutes from 3 ATMs. Need a taxi to get to the Vatican, but if you only have one bag it's easy to take the train and walk to the Hotel. Room was comfortable and clean, if small. It was on the front and traffic noises could be heard. Everything quieted down after 11 or 12 pm and it did not bother me. If you want quieter ask for one away from the front. Bathroom was nice and had all the amenities I needed. Staff was helpful and booked tours even on short notice. The tours were some of the best I've had anywhere. I will gladly stay in Hotel Torino again. A little on the expensive side, but worth the price to me as a single woman and I stayed in pricier hotels on this trip.. I felt very safe walking in the neighborhood after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveller1000
Reviews.Content: Hotel Torino was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. We stayed for 7 nights in this hotel. When we arrived there was complete indifference to us. not even a 'good afternoon and welcome'. There was no help with our luggage.Breakfast room was filthy and full of pidgeons eating off the tables. There was a bath in the room but no bath plug. We complained about this but nothing was done. We had a triple room. The double room had 2 single beds pushed together. In the single room my son had to sleep on a small sofa as the bed was a very uncomfortable camp bed. The staff were rude and obnoxious. We asked to get 3/4 of a bag of washing done by the hotel laundry service. It would have cost around €20 here in Ireland and they tried to charge us €298. We could get no satisfaction when we complained. They tried to charge us for items that we did not even have in our possession. We would certainly not reccomend this disgusting hotel to anyone who is thinking of going to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Nice few days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mcfcchris
Reviews.Content: We got moved from another 3* hotel (Fiamma) which was over-booked and we certainly didn't complain! The Torino was in a great central location (less than 5 mins walk from 2 metro stops, Termini and Repubblica, and the bus terminal). That said, if you don't mind the heat you can walk to places such as the Colloseum and Pantheon. It was noisy, but that applies to most of the city, so it's an idea to take earplugs. The breakfast was excellent, with several nice pastries, 3 different types of both ham and cheese, loads of fresh fruit and yoghurts, fruit juices cereals and so on. The outdoor breakfast room gave reasonable views of Rome. I found everyone friendly, though the hotel was fairly quiet (it was the last full week of July) so no one was too rushed! I also found the decor to be nice - the bed was fine, air conditioning wasn't noisy although the cold tap did make a bit of a funny noise at times! The shower was excellent, we didn't use the bidet at all so can't comment on that. The mini-bar was well stocked if a little pricey but of course you can use the fridge for your own drinks! Perfectly adequate lift, wardrobe, drawers and so on - all in in we enjoyed it and I'd give at least 4 out of 5! Of course maybe I'm happier because we paid a relatively low amount (as we'd paid for a 3*, around £50 per night for a double room) through lastminute.com. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: RABLancashire
Reviews.Content: Transferred to this hotel after being bumped from another hotel. Location 5 minutes walk from Termini and bus station. Very good breakfast on the sun terrace. Room standard very good and comfy twin beds. No view but quiet. Management very helpful

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaCruising07
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome after a cruise of the Greek Islands. The hotel is well located and was clean and the staff friendly. Nice touches...crisp linen hand towels in the baths, cold breakfast on the rooftop was delicious.The hotel has some recent renovations. The staff helped arrange our tours. We were surprised the bar just off the lobby was not open either night of our stay. They finally open it at 7:30 pm one evening just as we were leaving for dinner. One word of caution...watch out for the step at the landing of the main stairway. I slipped and my head crashed into the marble steps.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly and spacious”
Reviews.Author: geelonggirlAustralia
Reviews.Content: Needed to stay in Rome longer than had originally booked. The hotel we stayed in the night before could not accomodate us an extra night and we were forced to search for alternate accom. What a blessing in disguise this turned out to be! The staff were very friendly, the room bigger and cleaner than the other hotel - and considerably cheaper. Also had the best bathroom amenities I encountered anywhere in Italy! Great place - will stay there next time in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: peefor
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked into another hotel nearer the Forum but on arrival was told the agent had 'overbooked' but at no extra cost they were upgrading us to a 4 star hotel!!! If the Torino is a 4 star then I dread to think what a 3 star one is like. The hotel is well located although a walk to the centre of the city. A lot of good restaurants are around (recommend Est Est Est) but the hotel itself is shabby. The bar was never open and there was no room service whatsoever. The room was dark and dingy but clean. Breakfast is good and the view is quite stunning if you look beyond the rooftops. The advantage was that it was quiet at night as we had a back room but it would have been nice to have a bar - especially on the roof terrace. Would not recommend for 'special' break to Rome but ok for a tourist type 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not 4 star!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blondieIreland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day break in Rome, stayed in the Torino Hotel, great location, only 5 minutes from Romes main train station Termini and within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions (provided you have a decent comfortable footwear!!) however the hotel itself was very disappointing, advertised as a hotel which has been upgraded from its previous 3 stars to a 4 star due to "renovation" and improvements, were exactly these renovations occurred is a mystery to me, the rooms were old and badly in need of redecoration and while clean were really horrible and depressing!!! We had no view whatsoever and couldnt tell if it was day or night as our window was facing onto an enclosed area with views of other hotel windows and not a lot of natural light!!!!! Luckily the city itself is quite beautiful with plenty of amazing things to see, all the attractions are within easy walking distance, be prepared for long queues!!! Massive queue at the Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel so get there early to avoid disappointment, they close at 12.30!!! worth the wait though its quite breathtaking!!!! Would definately recommend Rome, a beautiful place to immerse yourself in history and art but if you like your hotels modern and bright dont stay in the Torino Hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BREAKFAST!!!!! Clean ROOMS : )”
Reviews.Author: kittygirl777
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great fullllll breakfast that's included in all the rooms. If you go all the way to the top floor, they have the breakfast room, fillled with all kinds of juices, hams (even prosciutto), fresh fruits, yogurts, fresh bread, sweet cakes, eggs, etc. (The breakfast would save you a lot of money, especially since everything tends to be expensive in Rome) The room was exceptionally clean. I went last thanksgiving and I think they just renovated and it was very clean and new. The staff is very courteous and speaks very good english.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Torino in June this year and found it to be very clean, very central (walking distance to all attractions with a good pair of walking boots), a stones throw from Termini, great breakfast and friendly staff. After reading the reviews of past visitors we didn't know what to expect but were pleasantly surprised. We don't spend much time in the room anyway and even though the walls were a little thin we were so zonked after a big day of touring around that we slept like babies. The only complaints I would have about our room was it was right underneath the restaurant downstairs where an accordian played most nights - a novely at first which soon wore off. The other is a slight electrical problem with the main light in our room which we tried to explain to staff but I don't think they had any idea what we were talking about. All in all a nice place to stay, but certainly not 5 star luxury by any means.

Reviews.Title: “A dismal hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4* hotel,. The rooms are shabby. Rain leaking through the ceiling into the bathroom was met with indifference by the hotel Reception staff - as was the burst hose on the hair dryer- a shrug and "yes, we know". Don't expect any other service apart from breakfast. The bar is never open and it is impossible to get tea, coffee etc other than at breakfast time. The rooms were very clean and breakfast was OK. It is in a good position for the Termini with buses to all areas, saving on taxis.

Reviews.Title: “noisey”
Reviews.Author: albair
Reviews.Content: small bedrooms in need of redecoration air condition not on traffic noise continues all night

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent two nights here last week. The hotel is in an excellent location and it was very easy to get from the airport to the termini station, from which it was a short 5 minute walk. The service was cold and impersonal but efficient. but I didn't mind that too much - Rome is renowned for this - so don't expect too many pleases and thankyou's and you'll be fine. Unfortunately the safe in our room failed and we had to wait 90 mins for it to be fixed. I told the manager we were upset about losing so much time but he really didn't seem to care. Then they forgot to label our bag that they put in the main safe at reception so that evening we had to argue to get our stuff back! Room was ok. Fairly comfortable beds, not too noisy and decent bathroom with a very high pressure shower which I loved! So not bad enough to ruin our trip but not great either. I can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Eh... Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Torino was the last hotel on our trip, and definitely the least desirable. It's servicable, in an ok location - for a cheap price, it'll do for a short stay. However... front desk staff is a little indifferent to your presence, the rooms are a little shabby, the cleaning service does the bare minimum to your room each night. We had no hot water in our room upon arrival (fixed after about an hour and a half.)

Reviews.Title: “I would go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a decent location, but my boyfriend and I were both treated rudely by the front desk staff and had several problems in our room. To get my 21-year-old boyfriend's attention as we walked out the hotel, the man at the front desk yelled "Hey little boy" across the lobby. On another occasion, we returned from a long day of walking around Rome in the rain to discover that we had no hot water in our room. Additionally, we could not get the air in our room to blow cool no matter what we did, including switching on the AC and turning it to the coolest setting. Overall, this hotel is overpriced for what it provides and I would recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money, go else where!”
Reviews.Author: nialltutton
Reviews.Content: Save your money, go else where! Small rooms; mold round windows; very lumpy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after it was recommended by a relative who had stayed there. We had pre booked a taxi transfer from Ciampino Airport via the internet before we travelled, as our flight was not due to arrive until about midnight and we thought that we may as well get to the hotel sooner rather than later. Unfortunately the taxi was late and we did not get to the hotel until about 1.00am. Even at this late hour, Armando the gentleman on reception was extremely polite and very helpful and greeted us very warmly. There were three adults in our party and as we are related we decided to book a triple room in order that one of us did not have to pay a single supplement. We expected to be allocated a standard room with either a double and one single bed or three singles. We were in fact allocated what they termed "a suite" and were greatly impressed by it. The suite consisted of one large bedroom with twin beds, and a smaller separate but more than adequately sized room containing a double metal action sofa bed, dressing table, wardrobe and air conditioning. This room could have easily slept two adults if necessary which would have meant that four people could have shared the suite. There was also a large bathroom which was immaculately clean and the bedlinen was changed once while we were there, even though we only stayed three nights. Breakfast on the terrace was a pleasant start to the day and consisted of the usual fruit juices, cereals, cold meat and cheeses, yoghurts, croissants, breads and jams. We found all staff pleasant and very helpful at all times and the hotel although on a busy street, was quiet at night. This ensured that we had a peaceful night's sleep. It is very close to the Termini Station which was great if you wanted to catch the Metro or a bus and it was also very close to major tourist sites. There were plenty of good restaurants all sensibly priced in the immediate area or within a short walking distance and we did not feel threatened at all walking about in this area at night. We only stayed for three nights and did not manage to fit in all of our planned sightseeing and so we will be returning to Rome again in the near future. We will most certainly stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fife_Flyer
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were met by a friendly member of staff who was polite, efficient and took the time to show us where the various sites were on the map. The room on the 6th floor which had an east facing window, was small but was the only hotel (1 of 4) on our holiday that had a double matress. All the others were 2 singles. Breakfast on the terrace was excellent and the terrace could be used for sun lounging if you asked the staff to unlock the door! Very convenient for the sights and also had a lot of convenience stores for those essentials nearby. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very average value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The check-in staff lack basic manners and need training on customer service. We were greeted with a sarcastic comment about having the honeymoon suite and were initially given a room which stunk of smoke, although it was supposedly a non-smoking room, and also the bed had a large lump down the middle. We were then given room 313, which was less offensive on the nose and the bed bump feature was smaller than in the first room. The room was quiet but basic and also the shower door meant that the bathroom flooded everytime the shower was used. The breakfast setting on the roof was quite pleasant and the overworked staff were friendly and accommodating. The hotel location was convenient for the great historical attractions of Rome but overall we recommend not staying at this hotel. It was poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, everything you need”
Reviews.Author: tenaxious
Reviews.Content: Located very conveniently near Termini station, I had been told that this was a bit of a dodgy area. I found nothing dodgy about it at all! The bedroom was a little small for two, but was clean and contained everything we needed. The weather was hot and the airconditioner worked well. Also the rooms were very quiet so you couldn't hear any outside noise and slept well. Continental breakfast was great, although just make sure you don't stress out the waiters! I wouldn't call the service prompt but we were in no hurry and as it was buffet style it didn't really matter. The setting on the rooftop was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lucillelesueur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, literally round the corner from Termini station and a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum area. Our room (115) was a good size with tv, air conditioning (a must in the Rome summer heat) and mini bar (tip: don't pay mini bar prices for the soft drinks/alcohol- go to the Conad supermarket in the basement level of Termini station and get drinks to put in the fridge- much cheaper!). The furnishings of the room were good, although our bed had a large lump in the middle as if two rather large people had been sleeping in our bed before us! The bathroom was a nice size, although the shower was a little on the small side and the hairdryer is not very powerful (I'd recommend you take your own if you can). There was a good choice for breakfast and it was lovely to sit on the sunny terrace overlooking Rome first thing in the morning. Yes, the bar was never open (while we were there they were bringing in lots of new glasses as if they were planning to open it soon, though) but who wants to sit in the hotel bar every night when you're in such a wonderful city as Rome!? Staff, although not the friendliest in the world, were helpful when needed and seemed nice enough (on checkout the man at the reception checked to make sure we had our passports and tickets!). I would stay at the Torino again if I ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The Key To The Sights of Rome”
Reviews.Author: siskinbob
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a long weekend (1st thru 4th July) stay at the Hotel Torino, celebrating my wifes birthday. I would rate this hotel as a 3 star. Our group had 2 rooms. One on the 2nd floor and one on the 6th floor. Both were of a good size though I would say that the furnishings are a little tired. The aircon was a boon as the temps in Rome were in the mid 30's. The only, small, criticism I have is that the shower cubicle was quite narrow. Being over 6ft tall and 19 stone I had to keep movement to a minimum otherwise I received a burst of very hot or very cold water depending on which way I knocked the shower control. Breakfast was included in our deal and I think it is probably the best spread that I have seen in a continental hotel. It was a buffet of meats (3/4 varieties), cheeses (3 choices), pastries (2/3 choices), fresh fruit, fruit juices and cereals. For 2 morning we had a young blonde waitress who provided coffee as soon as we arrived, also arranged the breakfast table so that we could all eat together. On the 3rd morning there was a different waitress. She was indifferent to our arrival. I had to go an ask for coffee and she made no attempt to arrange the table. I had to go and collect extra cutlery etc. myself. No big deal but not what we had come to expect based on previous experience. Hotel staff in general were very helpful and friendly especially on the front desk. They have a secure room to stow your suitcases in on departure day, ours wasn't until 17:30. The staff declined a tip when getting our luggage down to the foyer. The important point about this hotel is its position....literally 5 mins walk from Romes Termini railway station, bus terminus and Metro. Only 15mins amble from the Colloseum and Forum. We found it to be ideal for our needs. Would I stay there again...yes definitely. Would I recommend it.....yes definitely.....Bob N.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Abaminog
Reviews.Content: We bought our trip to Rome from Expedia and stayed in the Torino hotel from 18-22 Jun 2005. The room we got was a modest size with all promised amenities: large bed, TV, bathroom, air con, small fridge. The air con was absolutely essential as the temperatures in Rome soared to 35 C those days! It was one of those older centralised air cons making very audible humming noise when it works. But it's hard to complain as it was quite efficient keeping us cool (even too cool sometimes!) day and night. An obvious downside, in my opinion, was a too small shower cabin with no hard walls that was separated from the rest of the bathroom only by a thin curtain. As a result, the water was all over the place when we were taking shower and there was hardly any room to move inside the shower cabin. But that was just a minor negative thing that in no way spolit our stay. The hotel staff was relatively friendly and helpful if you compare them with generally mediocre level of service in Italy. People at the reception spoke some English that was good enough to get by. There is a number of small restaurants nearby to have lunch or dinner. They are not very high quality but quite affordable and should do if you don't expect a fancy night out. When booking the trip, we were offered a hotel breakfast option for extra c. $8 per night (this covers both of us). We took this option and never regretted about it. The breakfast area is on the roof terrace with all usual stuff available: cold meats, bread, fruit, juices, cereal, coffee/tea, etc. The selection of food was the same every day but if you don't stay there for longer than 2-3 days, you're not going to get sick of it. Having a quick good breakfast for the very reasonable money saves you valuable time in the morning. Overall, the stay at Torino was fairly comfortable and pleasant. The hotel offered us a good refuge after long hot days in town. I wouldn't rate it as 4-star though but I believe it deserves solid 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality stay”
Reviews.Author: expectthebest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Torino for 4 nights in February and had very little to complain about. The room was basic but comfortable with a small balcony and provided a good base for sightseeing. The only real problems were the shower, which was hand-held and the double bed which was two singles pushed together with a height difference! The staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast was very nice, a cold buffet with lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: JudyMetroNYCarea
Reviews.Content: We were downgraded to the Hotel Torino from another hotel in the hotel chain due to the fact that we booked through Expedia and not directly with the hotel. The room was a tiny, inside room with a view of the hotel air vent! We could not leave the window open. Even after down-grading us, they didn't bother to upgrade the room. The staff at the front desk was snotty. the bar was never open. The location was ok and the breakfast was the best part of the stay. Thank god we did not need to spend alot of time at the hotel or in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Torino with my partner in February. I was slightly worried because of the reviews I'd read but we had a really lovely stay. The staff at the reception was very friendly by Italian standards and offered a lot of tourist information. Our room was on the 6th floor and was a good size with a particularly large bathroom and shower. Breakfast was one of the best I've had on the continent - I was a big fan of the filled croissants! I'd booked the hotel mainly because the location was really good, handy for Termini where you can catch both Metro lines and an easy walk to the Coliseum. One tip I'd give is not to buy any food or drink from shops or stalls near-by, they can spot a tourist a mile off and will consequently charge you double!!

Reviews.Title: “So rude, you have to laugh- but great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Torino for 3 inconsecutive nights in January of 2005, during a 2 week vacation in Italy. The hotel is a short walk from the train station (about an hour train ride from the airport - take the Express- no stops) and is within walking distance to Capitoline Hill, the Roman Forum, the Colosseum, the Spanish Steps, etc. Great location! Upon check in, the staff is so rude that it's almost funny. Don't expect any help, let alone an acknowledgment that you asked a question at all. We had to laugh! Sometimes they joined us in a good laugh, so I think they are being rude on purpose. Maybe it adds to the hotel's "charm..." Both rooms we stayed in had extremely clean bathrooms and very old and lumpy beds (I had already expected that after reading the reviews here on TripAdvisor). Our first room had a little balcony with a lemon tree, and a view of the street. The second room had no view or balcony, but that's ok, we just needed a place to sleep after all the walking and site seeing. There's a TV, but no English speaking stations. Breakfast was not bad & the staff was nice enough to hold our luggage for 4 days while we visited other cities. I might stay there again, only because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec 2004. We had a pleasant stay for our first 3 nights because we checked in very early in the day. However, when we returned a week later from Venice and checked in late (11pm) we got awful rooms given to us…. No shower doors, dirty linen, very small, etc. We asked for a room change and was told to deal with it in the morning. We eventually got our room changed but our parents did not. Overall, we had an "ok" time here just because we used it for a place to sleep while we toured Rome. I would NOT stay here for any other reason except to tour the city and convenience to the train station. Highly recommend the restaurant it’s affiliated with below in the basement around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: BJM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2nd week in January 2005 for 7 days - and would rate the hotel as 2 star. The staff varied from positively unhelpful to OK. The room and bathroom was small (OK for city hotel) and on the plus it was clean. Furnishings and decoration - very tired. The bar in hotel never opened and when we asked for a drink we were just told it was closed! Breakfasts were quite good - generally the pastries and bread fresh (although less so at weekend). Location fine if you want to be near station and there were some OK restaurants in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “three star hotel, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: kimbeg73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel end of November 04 and the standard of the hotel was very much three star and a bit shabby - not four star as quoted by expedia. We were there on our wedding anniversary and were very dissapointed. Our room on the first night was absolutely tiny (room 31) and looked nothing like the photos on expedia. We complained - and they offered to change our room the next day. The next day we were shifted to a room on the first floor - which was only slightly larger than the first night, with an even smaller bathroom. Breakfast is served on the top floor of the hotel and it does have a good view - but the breakfast itself is rubbish. When we were there the fruit was entirely blue with mould, and the staff were making no effort to clean up or remove it. Very disappointing. Two days was enough and we shifted to the International Palace Hotel - which was slightly cheaper and a definately 4 star hotel, closer to the sights and with much bigger rooms and considerably better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Moorse
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night trip to Rome staying at the Hotel Torino. Great location, just a few minutes easy walk from the Termini. The reviews are pretty spot on but I found the room we stayed in a little tired at the end of a long season. However, as a base of operations, it is perfectly suited to a short break in Rome, with all of the tourist attractions within walking distance. (Make sure you take some comfortable walking shoes!) Hotel was clean and staff were friendly. Good breakfasts to start the day. Note of caution, if using the Metro, beware pick pockets, they tried it on my wife and I, and they were only kids! Also saw a gang of pick pockets on the Spansih Steps so keep all valuables in inside pockets! Loved Rome, would go back again some day. Particular reference to the Ristorante del Giglio, just two minutes walk from Hotel Torino opposite the Opera House. Great food, great wine, great service and a reasonable price - value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Very clean rooms and bathrooms. Bathrooms marble effect large shower, bidet airconditioned. Bed not too hard not too soft! Double glazed windows, simple decoration not overfussy. Good hearty breakfast. Choice of cereals, cheese, meats, various citrus drinks, fantastic coffee bread etc nice rooftop terrace or interior breakfast room. Friendly advising staff. Close but not too close to termini station. I witnessed one pickpocket who was caught middle of the day at the station. I felt very safe in the hotel and at the station. Just a massive train station and as with all large gatherings of people not knowing where they are going perfect for thieves. Good fast bus service. Not too far from main attractions. Easy walking distance from colosseum and roman forum. I would stay there again. My choice of hotel was based on reviews from this site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--August, 2004”
Reviews.Author: lagirl55
Reviews.Content: We (family of four) stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Torino in Aug. 2004 and it was great! The weather was hot and humid, but the rooms are nicely air-conditioned and have thick wooden shutters that shut out all light and sound, so we slept very well. The roof-top terrace is beautiful. We had a very nice buffet breakfast every morning overlooking the beautiful city of Rome. Does it get any better than that? The hotel is 3 blocks from Stazione Termini, a very convenient location. We walked to the hotel from the station upon arrival and used the station every day to catch the Metro and buses as we toured Rome. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “They run a tight ship, solid hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in Rome and stayed at Torino for our whole trip. The staff was helpful, the man at the front desk even suggested Gaeta and booked a hotel there for us when we needed a little time away from the hustle bustle of Rome. The breakfasts were pretty good, there was enough to choose from. The location was great for both access to the Esquiline (an underrated, very cool, not too touristy neighborhood ), the Jewish neighborhood, the Trastavere and proximity to the trains for sidetrips. It was about an average of 10-15 minute walk to Piazza Navona, Campo de Fiore and Piazza di Spagna areas and only 5-10 minute walk to the Forum. Torino is very clean and they have smashing hand towels!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Torino
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo, 8, 00185 Rome, Italy
